item.title: Second ODI: Indian batting needs fresh approach to save series against New Zealand
item.description: Second ODI: Indian batting needs fresh approach to save series against New Zealand Hamilton: India would expect a better approach from skipper Shikhar Dhawan and young Shubman Gill in the Powerplay overs when the team clashes with New Zealand in the do-or-die second One-Day International here Sunday.

item.title: PT Usha throws her hat into IOA ring, to fight for president’s post
item.description: PT Usha throws her hat into IOA ring, to fight for president’s post The legendary P T Usha on Saturday announced that she will contest for the post of Indian Olympic Association

item.title: India go down to Aussies despite Akashdeep treble
item.description: India go down to Aussies despite Akashdeep treble Adelaide: Akashdeep Singh’s hat-trick went in vain as India conceded two late goals to lose 4-5 against Australia in the high-scoring first hockey Test of the five-match series here Saturday.

item.title: Collegium system alien to constitution: Law Minister
item.description: Collegium system alien to constitution: Law Minister No institution in a constitutional democracy, including collegium, is perfect: CJI Amid frequent run-ins between the government and the judiciary, Union Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on Friday pitched for fraternal ties between the two pillars of democracy, saying they are like brothers and should not fight each other.

item.title: Top 10 News: रेलवे से निकाले जा रहे भ्रष्ट अधिकारी, गहलोत-पायलट में दिखी दूरियां
item.description: Top 10 News: रेलवे से निकाले जा रहे भ्रष्ट अधिकारी, गहलोत-पायलट में दिखी दूरियां Today's Top 10 News: जेल में बंद आप नेता सत्येंद्र जैन के लीक वीडियो के मामले पर आज होगी सुनवाई.

item.title: Jacqueline Fernandez arrives at Delhi court in money laundering case involving conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar
item.description: Jacqueline Fernandez arrives at Delhi court in money laundering case involving conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar On Thursday, November 24, actor Jacqueline Fernandez arrived at the Patiala House Court in Delhi in connection with the Rs 200 crore money laundering case involving conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar.

item.title: Hindu Mahasabha plans to rename Meerut after Nathuram Godse, if elected
item.description: Hindu Mahasabha plans to rename Meerut after Nathuram Godse, if elected Meerut: The Hindu Mahasabha promised that it will change the name of Meerut to Nathuram Godse Nagar if they comes to power in the upcoming civic polls in Uttar Pradesh.

item.title: Telangana: Concern voiced over BJP’s misuse of central agencies
item.description: Telangana: Concern voiced over BJP’s misuse of central agencies Nalgonda: Leaders of different organizations have in a single voice expressed strong concern over the misuse of central agencies including the Enforcement Directorate (ED) and the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) by the BJP government to target opposition parties.

item.title: Terrorists use dark web to radicalise, funnel crypto currency: Amit Shah
item.description: Terrorists use dark web to radicalise, funnel crypto currency: Amit Shah New Delhi: Union Home Minister Amit Shah Friday said terrorists are spreading radicalism among youth and using elements like dark web and virtual assests to hide their identities.

item.title: Covid-19 Updates: India logs 635 new cases, 11 deaths in last 24 hours

item.description: नोएडा एक्सटेंशन के La Residentia सोसायटी की लिफ्ट में पेट डॉग ने बच्चे को काटा, लगे 4 इंजेक्शन आमतौर पर बच्चों को पहले स्ट्रीट डॉग से खतरा हुआ करता था लेकिन अब तो पेट डॉग.

item.title: ब्रिटेन के PM बनने के बाद पहली बार पीएम मोदी से मिले ऋषि सुनक, ऐसी रही बातचीत
item.description: ब्रिटेन के PM बनने के बाद पहली बार पीएम मोदी से मिले ऋषि सुनक, ऐसी रही बातचीत बाली में जी20 शिखर सम्मेलन के पहले दिन प्रधानमंत्री नरेंद्र मोदी और ऋषि सुनक ने चर्चा की.

item.description: Vice President Dhankhar meets Cambodian PM, discuss bilateral ties Both leaders also witnessed the exchange of four agreements in the areas of culture, wildlife and health.

item.title: Musk's lawyer tells Twitter employees they won't go to jail
item.description: Musk’s lawyer tells Twitter employees they won’t go to jail A lawyer working for Elon Musk has reassured Twitter staff that they will not go to jail for being liable if the company violated the requirements of the Federal Trade Commission's (FTC) consent decree

item.title: MCD Polls: AAP promises to end corruption in ‘Kejriwal Ki 10 Guarantees’
item.description: MCD Polls: AAP promises to end corruption in ‘Kejriwal Ki 10 Guarantees’ New Delhi: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Friday released its ‘Kejriwal ki 10 guarantee’ for Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) polls scheduled for December 4.

item.title: Attack on Owaisi in UP: SC quashes HC order granting bail to two accused
item.description: Attack on Owaisi in UP: SC quashes HC order granting bail to two accused A bench of Justices M R Shah and M M Sundresh said the high court did not accord any reason while giving bail.

item.title: WATCH: PM Modi unveils 108-feet-tall bronze statue of Bengaluru founder 'Nadaprabhu' Kempegowda
item.description: WATCH: PM Modi unveils 108-feet-tall bronze statue of Bengaluru founder ‘Nadaprabhu’ Kempegowda On November 11, Prime Minister Narendra Modi unveiled a 108-feet-tall bronze statue of Bengaluru founder 'Nadaprabhu' Kempegowda.

item.title: West Bengal: A suspected member of Al Qaeda in the Indian subcontinent arrested in Kolkata
item.description: West Bengal: A suspected member of Al Qaeda in the Indian subcontinent arrested in Kolkata Kolkata: A suspected member of the terror outfit, Al Qaeda in the Indian subcontinent (AQIS) and Ansarullah Bangla Team, was arrested in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district, a senior officer told news agency PTI.

item.description: DU admission 2022: More than 8,100 students allotted seats in second round New Delhi: Over 8,100 new student applicants have been allotted seats in second round of college and programme allocation of Delhi University (DU), a DU registrar has informed PTI.

item.description: Delhi pollution: GRAP stage 3 kicks in as air quality deteriorates, know what all will be affected Under GRAP stage 3, states may impose restrictions on the plying of BS III petrol and BS IV diesel four-wheelers in the NCR.

item.title: Gujarat: PM Narendra Modi’s meet with Patidar leader sets tongues wagging
item.description: Gujarat: PM Narendra Modi’s meet with Patidar leader sets tongues wagging Ahmedabad: Amid speculation that Prime Minister Narendra Modi may visit influential Patidar organisations on Sardar Patel’s birth anniversary on October 31 in a renewed bid to win over the community, Naresh Patel, Chairman of the Shree Khodaldham Trust, met him at his residence in New Delhi on Saturday evening.

item.title: Gujarat BJP targets Kejriwal over cracker ban in Delhi
item.description: Gujarat BJP targets Kejriwal over cracker ban in Delhi Rajkot: Gujarat BJP chief C R Paatil has hit out at Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal over his government’s decision to completely ban firecrackers in the national capital, and dubbed such people “anti-religious” who were stopping citizens from celebrating their festivals.
